intro: Cascarilla undata, commonly known as the rough bark tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its rough, fissured bark. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 15 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. The flowers are small and clustered, and the fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds.
